analyzed: las bdag gis bya ba gtsor gsungs so //

analyzed: de nas bu ni zhe spya ba ni slob ma bzang po dang / rang gi bu'o //

analyzed: kha cig na re bu zhes bya ba rang gi bu tha mal pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Some say that the so-called son is not an ordinary son,

original: pha la ngan du smra ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha la ngan du smra ba srid pa'i phyir ro //

original: de bas na dpal bde mchog las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na dpal bde mchog las kyang /
translated: Therefore, in the glorious Cakrasaṃvara it is said:

original: spun dang bu gcig lhan cig tu //
analyzed: spun dang bu gcig lhan cig tu //
translated: Together with the brother and only son,

original: bde dang sdug bsngal kun 'byung bya //
analyzed: bde dang sdug bsngal kun 'byung bya //
translated: the origin of all happiness and suffering,

original: ye shes der ba stan mi bya ste //
analyzed: ye shes der ba stan mi bya ste //
translated: the wisdom being should not be dismissed,

original: sngags dang phyag rgya de bzhin no //
analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgya de bzhin no //
translated: nor the mantra and mudrā.

original: zhes gsungs so zhes zer te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs so zhes zer te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de ni nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni nges pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not certain,

original: gsang ba zla ba'i thig le las //
analyzed: gsang ba zla ba'i thig le las //
translated: because in the Secret Moon Drop🔽it is said:🔽The secret mantras, mudrās,

original: gsang sngags rnams dang phyag rgya dang // de bzhin thabs dang shes rab rnams //
analyzed: gsang sngags rnams dang phyag rgya dang // de bzhin thabs dang shes rab rnams //
translated: and likewise the methods and wisdoms,

original: thabs dang shes rab thams cad kyang //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab thams cad kyang //
translated: all the methods and wisdoms,

original: sngags pas gsang ba'i rnal 'byor gyis //
analyzed: sngags pas gsang ba'i rnal 'byor gyis //
translated: the mantra practitioner, through the secret yoga,🔽should not dismiss the wisdom being.

original: dmyal ba ngan song bzlog pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dmyal ba ngan song bzlog pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to avert the hells and bad rebirths,

original: bu dang slob ma la spyin bya //
analyzed: bu dang slob ma la spyin bya //
translated: give to one’s children and disciples.🔽And in the Noble Compendium of Suchness,

original: zhes gsungs la /🔽'phags pa de kho na nyid 'dus pa las kyang /🔽slob dpon ma yin gzhan dang ni //🔽slob ma ma yin bu min pa'i //
analyzed: zhes gsungs la / 'phags pa de kho na nyid 'dus pa las kyang / slob dpon ma yin gzhan dang ni // slob ma ma yin bu min pa'i //
translated: it says:🔽“Do not speak the seal in front of🔽someone who is not a master,

original: mdun du / phyag rgya mi brjod de //🔽de dag gsang bas phyag rgya 'grub //
analyzed: mdun du / phyag rgya mi brjod de // de dag gsang bas phyag rgya 'grub //
translated: who is not a disciple, or who is not one’s son,

original: ces gsungs te /
analyzed: ces gsungs te /
translated: for the seal is accomplished by secrecy.”

original: de bas na rang bzhin bzang po 'ba' zhig gtsor bya'i //🔽rigs nye @326a * //
analyzed: de bas na rang bzhin bzang po 'ba' zhig gtsor bya'i // rigs nye @326a * //
translated: Therefore, one should emphasize only a good nature.🔽One should not consider here whether someone is a close relative,

original: ba dang / ring ba dang / pho mo la sogs pa ni 'dir mi gzung ngo //
analyzed: ba dang / ring ba dang / pho mo la sogs pa ni 'dir mi gzung ngo //
translated: a distant relative, a man, a woman, and so on.🔽Similarly, the other passages that are cited, such as “a king,” and so on,

original: de bzhin du rgyal po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhan du 'dren pa rnams kyang bsal te mi dgag par byas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyal po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhan du 'dren pa rnams kyang bsal te mi dgag par byas pa'o //
translated: are to be understood as not being prohibitions.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: de nas bslab pa bshad de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: de nas bslab pa bshad de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: Then, the explanation of the training, and so on,

original: dug bsal ba'i sgrub pa'i thabs ston te /
analyzed: dug bsal ba'i sgrub pa'i thabs ston te /
translated: teaches the method of accomplishing the removal of poison.

original: 'di mi rnams la 'tshe ba'i klu ni /
analyzed: 'di mi rnams la 'tshe ba'i klu ni /
translated: The nāgas who harm humans🔽are of two kinds: those who live in the water and those who live on land.

original: glang po che dang / rta dang / sprul dang / sbal pa dang / nya dag gi rigs su gnas par gsungs la /
analyzed: glang po che dang / rta dang / sprul dang / sbal pa dang / nya dag gi rigs su gnas par gsungs la /
translated: It is said that they live in the families of elephants, horses, snakes, frogs, and fish.

original: de dag las kyang sprul gyi rigs ni mi rnams la rab tu 'tshe ba mang ba yin zhing /
analyzed: de dag las kyang sprul gyi rigs ni mi rnams la rab tu 'tshe ba mang ba yin zhing /
translated: Among them, the snake family is the most harmful to humans.

original: de yang rigs brgyang cu yod de /
analyzed: de yang rigs brgyang cu yod de /
translated: There are one hundred and twenty types of snakes.

original: 'phags pa dpung bzangs kyis zhus pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa dpung bzangs kyis zhus pa las /
translated: The Subāhuparipṛcchā says:🔽There are one hundred and twenty types of snakes

original: sa yi steng ni sprul ni brgyang cu dag //
analyzed: sa yi steng ni sprul ni brgyang cu dag //
translated: on the surface of the earth.

original: gzhan la gnod pa byed cing rnam par 'khyam //🔽zhes gsungs so //🔽de la dug med pa'i rigs ni /
analyzed: gzhan la gnod pa byed cing rnam par 'khyam // zhes gsungs so // de la dug med pa'i rigs ni /
translated: They harm others and wander about.

original: bcu gnyis su zad de /
analyzed: bcu gnyis su zad de /
translated: The types of snakes that are not poisonous are exhausted at twelve.

original: lhag ma rnams ni dug dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni dug dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The rest are poisonous.

original: de la dug can de dag kyang rigs rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la dug can de dag kyang rigs rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The poisonous ones are of three types:

original: khro bo dang lus 'khyil pa dang / gdengs ka can rnams so //
analyzed: khro bo dang lus 'khyil pa dang / gdengs ka can rnams so //
translated: the angry, the coiled, and the hooded.

original: de la gang gi tshe sprul khro bos zin pa de'i tshe ni /
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe sprul khro bos zin pa de'i tshe ni /
translated: When a person is bitten by an angry snake,

original: rma'i sgo skya la skrang pa dang / 'byil zhing snum la khrag 'dzag pa dang / cung zad skam zhing bad kan rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rma'i sgo skya la skrang pa dang / 'byil zhing snum la khrag 'dzag pa dang / cung zad skam zhing bad kan rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the wound is swollen, oozing, oily, and bleeding, and if it is slightly dry, it is a phlegm disorder.

original: gal te sprul lus 'khyil pas zin na /
analyzed: gal te sprul lus 'khyil pas zin na /
translated: If the wound is seized by a coiled-bodied snake,

original: rma'i srol chen po la /
analyzed: rma'i srol chen po la /
translated: the wound will be very large,

original: ser zhing rab tu skrang ste /
analyzed: ser zhing rab tu skrang ste /
translated: yellow, and very swollen.

original: mkhris pa rgyas par byed do //
analyzed: mkhris pa rgyas par byed do //
translated: It will cause a proliferation of bile.

original: gal te sprul gdengs ka can gyis zin na /
analyzed: gal te sprul gdengs ka can gyis zin na /
translated: If the wound is seized by a hooded snake,

original: rma'i sgo gang ste rlung 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: rma'i sgo gang ste rlung 'phel bar byed do //
translated: the wound will be open and will cause an increase of wind.

original: klu'i rigs ma lus pa'i dug dbye ba ni lta ba dang / dbugs dang / reg pa dang / so'i dug dang bzhi nyid do //
analyzed: klu'i rigs ma lus pa'i dug dbye ba ni lta ba dang / dbugs dang / reg pa dang / so'i dug dang bzhi nyid do //
translated: The poisons of all the nāga types are classified as four: sight, breath, touch, and tooth poison.

original: de la reg pa ni lus dang / kha chu dang bshang gcis reg pas dug tu gyur te /
analyzed: de la reg pa ni lus dang / kha chu dang bshang gcis reg pas dug tu gyur te /
translated: Among them, touch is the poison that comes from contact with the body, saliva, or feces.

original: lta ba ni mig gdug pa ste /
analyzed: lta ba ni mig gdug pa ste /
translated: Sight is the poison of the eyes.

original: mthong ba tsam gyis dug tu 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba tsam gyis dug tu 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is a poison that comes from merely seeing it.

original: dbugs ni kha rlangs me lta bur tsha ba'am chu ltar bsil bas reg na dug tu 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dbugs ni kha rlangs me lta bur tsha ba'am chu ltar bsil bas reg na dug tu 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Breath is the poison that comes from contact with the hot breath like fire or the cold breath like water.

original: so'i dug ni mche bas btab pa las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: so'i dug ni mche bas btab pa las gyur pa'o //
translated: The poison of the teeth is that which comes from the bite.

original: de yang dang po gsum ni mdze nad dang / lkugs pa dang / zha ba dang / 'theng ba la sogs pa dang / lto sbo ba la sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang dang po gsum ni mdze nad dang / lkugs pa dang / zha ba dang / 'theng ba la sogs pa dang / lto sbo ba la sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, the first three become leprosy, dumbness, lameness, and so on, and a swollen belly, and so on.

original: so'i dug ni dbyibs lta bur lta ba ste /
analyzed: so'i dug ni dbyibs lta bur lta ba ste /
translated: The poison of the teeth is like the shape of the teeth.

original: sngar ba stan pa gsum nyid do //
analyzed: sngar ba stan pa gsum nyid do //
translated: The three previously mentioned are just that.

original: de yang rnam pa bzhi ste /🔽ji skad du /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bzhi ste / ji skad du /
translated: Moreover, there are four types.

original: 'phags pa dpung bzangs kyis zhus pa las gsungs @326b pa ;
analyzed: 'phags pa dpung bzangs kyis zhus pa las gsungs @326b pa ;
translated: As it is said in the Ārya Subāhupariprcchā:

original: zos pa de yang rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te //
analyzed: zos pa de yang rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te //
translated: That which is bitten also becomes four types:

original: mche bas zin dang sos bcad gtad pa'o //
analyzed: mche bas zin dang sos bcad gtad pa'o //
translated: That which is seized by the fangs, that which is cut by the teeth, and that which is spit out.

original: gang gis mtshe ba gcig gis khrag byung rjes //
analyzed: gang gis mtshe ba gcig gis khrag byung rjes //
translated: If blood comes from one fang,

original: de ni dug byung bas ni zin par bshad //🔽gang du mche ba gnyis kyis btab nas su //
analyzed: de ni dug byung bas ni zin par bshad // gang du mche ba gnyis kyis btab nas su //
translated: it is said to be seized by the poison that has come out.🔽If blood comes from the two fangs

original: khrag phyung bar ni 'gyur bar zos pa'o //
analyzed: khrag phyung bar ni 'gyur bar zos pa'o //
translated: where they have bitten, that is the bite.

original: gal te mche ba gsum gyis sha bcad na //
analyzed: gal te mche ba gsum gyis sha bcad na //
translated: If the flesh is cut by three fangs,

original: de ni bcad bar gyur pa yin zhes ba stan //
analyzed: de ni bcad bar gyur pa yin zhes ba stan //
translated: it is said to be the cut.

original: gang du mche ba bzhi yis btab nas so //
analyzed: gang du mche ba bzhi yis btab nas so //
translated: Where, having been bitten by the four fangs,

original: sprul gyi lus ni bzlog par 'gyur ba de //
analyzed: sprul gyi lus ni bzlog par 'gyur ba de //
translated: The body of the snake is turned back.

original: gtad nas zos pa yin zhes bshad pa ste //
analyzed: gtad nas zos pa yin zhes bshad pa ste //
translated: It is said that having been entrusted, it is eaten,

original: de ni sman rnams kyis kyang bzlog par dka' //
analyzed: de ni sman rnams kyis kyang bzlog par dka' //
translated: And that is difficult to reverse even with medicines.🔽The poison that penetrates the vital points with the nature of fire,🔽Which is like a weapon and similar, is not pacified

original: me yi rang bzhin gnad du 'phen pa'i dug / mtshon dang 'dra zhing mtshungs pa dag / ji ltar sngags kyis rab tu zhi 'gyur ba //
analyzed: me yi rang bzhin gnad du 'phen pa'i dug / mtshon dang 'dra zhing mtshungs pa dag / ji ltar sngags kyis rab tu zhi 'gyur ba //
translated: By mantras,

original: de bzhin sman gyis zhi bar mi nus so //
analyzed: de bzhin sman gyis zhi bar mi nus so //
translated: Nor can it be pacified by medicines.

original: ji ltar me dpung chen po bud shing la //
analyzed: ji ltar me dpung chen po bud shing la //
translated: Just as a great mass of fire

original: nges par bsregs la char 'bab skad cig gis //
analyzed: nges par bsregs la char 'bab skad cig gis //
translated: Is extinguished in an instant by the rain falling on the fuel,

original: zhi bar 'gyur ba de bzhin dug dag ni //
analyzed: zhi bar 'gyur ba de bzhin dug dag ni //
translated: In the same way, the poisons,

original: me dpung lta bu'ang sngags kyis zhi bar byed //
analyzed: me dpung lta bu'ang sngags kyis zhi bar byed //
translated: Like a mass of fire, are pacified by mantras.

original: dug gi mthu rtogs shes nas rab bsgrims te //
analyzed: dug gi mthu rtogs shes nas rab bsgrims te //
translated: Having understood the power of the poison, being very attentive,

original: gsang sngags cho ga bzhin brlabs bsgrubs na ni //
analyzed: gsang sngags cho ga bzhin brlabs bsgrubs na ni //
translated: If one blesses and accomplishes according to the ritual of the secret mantra,

original: ba lang khyu na seng ge ji lta bar //
analyzed: ba lang khyu na seng ge ji lta bar //
translated: Just as a lion in a herd of oxen,

original: dug dang sprul dang dgos med lhan cig rtse //
analyzed: dug dang sprul dang dgos med lhan cig rtse //
translated: One plays together with poison, snakes, and useless things.

original: zhes so // de dag gi dug dbyung ba'i rgyu yang de nyid las gsungs pa ;
analyzed: zhes so // de dag gi dug dbyung ba'i rgyu yang de nyid las gsungs pa ;
translated: The causes for removing their poisons are also taught in that very tantra:

original: dug 'phrog khro bo'i dbang gyur skrag pa dang // de bzhin sngags pa'am bkres pa'i zas phyir ram //
analyzed: dug 'phrog khro bo'i dbang gyur skrag pa dang // de bzhin sngags pa'am bkres pa'i zas phyir ram //
translated: The poisons are removed by the one who is overcome by the wrathful one, by the frightened one, and likewise by the one who is hungry for the food of mantra,

original: sha khon yod pa'am gshin rjes ba stan pa'am //
analyzed: sha khon yod pa'am gshin rjes ba stan pa'am //
translated: by the one who has a grudge, or by the one who is instructed by the Lord of Death,

original: lus la brdzis na de dag za par byed //
analyzed: lus la brdzis na de dag za par byed //
translated: or by the one who is trampled by the body, they are eaten.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is.

original: byis pa gang dag yul gyi rang bzhin ma shes pa de dag la dug de dag gis gnod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byis pa gang dag yul gyi rang bzhin ma shes pa de dag la dug de dag gis gnod par 'gyur te /
translated: Those childish ones who do not know the nature of the objects are harmed by those poisons.

original: 'di skad du dpal sangs rgyas thod pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di skad du dpal sangs rgyas thod pa las gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said in the glorious Buddhakapala:

original: tha mal yul rnams sprul yin te //
analyzed: tha mal yul rnams sprul yin te //
translated: The ordinary objects are emanations.🔽The faults of the objects are poisons.

original: yul rnams kyi ni nyes pa dug / lha rnams yul rnams ma shes phyir //
analyzed: yul rnams kyi ni nyes pa dug / lha rnams yul rnams ma shes phyir //
translated: Because the gods do not know the objects,

original: thams cad dus su zin pa yin //
analyzed: thams cad dus su zin pa yin //
translated: they are seized at all times.

original: zhes te / byis pa de lta bu rnams la thugs brtse bas /
analyzed: zhes te / byis pa de lta bu rnams la thugs brtse bas /
translated: Thus, out of compassion for such childish ones,

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po rnams las dug bsal ba'i cho ga rgyas par gsungs la /
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po rnams las dug bsal ba'i cho ga rgyas par gsungs la /
translated: the rituals for removing poisons are extensively taught in the king of tantras.

original: rgyud 'dir yang /
analyzed: rgyud 'dir yang /
translated: And in this tantra,

original: mig dang / dbugs dang / reg pa dang / mche ba'i dug rnams bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mig dang / dbugs dang / reg pa dang / mche ba'i dug rnams bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: breath, touch, and fangs,

original: bsam gtan dang / sngags dang / phyag rgya'i bya ba bla na med pa gsungs so /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / sngags dang / phyag rgya'i bya ba bla na med pa gsungs so /
translated: the unsurpassed activities of concentration, mantra, and seal are taught.

original: @327a * // de la re zhig rnal 'byor pas yid dmigs pa la gnas pa thob par byas la //
analyzed: @327a * // de la re zhig rnal 'byor pas yid dmigs pa la gnas pa thob par byas la //
translated: Therein, first, the yogi/nī should attain mental stability on the object.

original: klu'i dkyil 'khor ji skad du gsungs pa las /
analyzed: klu'i dkyil 'khor ji skad du gsungs pa las /
translated: In the maṇḍala of the nāgas as taught,

original: cung zad du rdo rje 'chang dbu la sprul mgo ji snyed pa de snyed kyi 'od zer dkar po kha ba ltar bsil bas bskor ba bskyed la mchod pa'i bar du bya ste /
analyzed: cung zad du rdo rje 'chang dbu la sprul mgo ji snyed pa de snyed kyi 'od zer dkar po kha ba ltar bsil bas bskor ba bskyed la mchod pa'i bar du bya ste /
translated: a little above Vajradhara, one should generate as many white light rays as there are nāga heads, surrounded by snow-like coolness, up to the offerings.

original: phud ces ba ba 'bum phrag gcig bzlas te /
analyzed: phud ces ba ba 'bum phrag gcig bzlas te /
translated: Recite the mantra “puṣpe” one hundred thousand times.

original: 'di ni sngon du bsnyen pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sngon du bsnyen pa'o //
translated: This is the preliminary service.

original: de nas bong la sogs pa'i dbyig dug blangs te /
analyzed: de nas bong la sogs pa'i dbyig dug blangs te /
translated: Then, having taken the poison of the wealth of donkeys and so forth,

original: srang tshad la legs par bcal la /
analyzed: srang tshad la legs par bcal la /
translated: weigh it properly on a scale,

original: dkyil 'khor snga ma bzhin bsams la /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor snga ma bzhin bsams la /
translated: and imagine the maṇḍala as before.

original: bdag gi lag pa g-yas ba'i mthil du yang /
analyzed: bdag gi lag pa g-yas ba'i mthil du yang /
translated: On the palm of one’s right hand,

original: phud ces bya ba'i yi ge kha dog dkar po las ;
analyzed: phud ces bya ba'i yi ge kha dog dkar po las ;
translated: from the syllable “puṣpe” white in color,

original: padma dkar po 'dab ma brgyang pa'i 'dab ma la /
analyzed: padma dkar po 'dab ma brgyang pa'i 'dab ma la /
translated: On the petals of a lotus with a hundred thousand petals,🔽

original: lha rnams gnas par bskyed la /
analyzed: lha rnams gnas par bskyed la /
translated: The deities are generated on the petals of a white lotus with one hundred petals.

original: dkyil 'khor gnyis las 'od zer dkar po byung bas dug de dag la phog pas /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gnyis las 'od zer dkar po byung bas dug de dag la phog pas /
translated: White light rays come from the two maṇḍalas and touch the poisons,

original: bdud rtsi'i bdag nyid du bsam zhing /
analyzed: bdud rtsi'i bdag nyid du bsam zhing /
translated: which are imagined to be the nature of amṛta.

original: dug de'i steng du yi ge phu: dkar po gnas pa las /
analyzed: dug de'i steng du yi ge phu: dkar po gnas pa las /
translated: A white syllable phaṭ resides above the poison.

original: 'od zer dkar po byung bas kyang de ltar bsam mo //
analyzed: 'od zer dkar po byung bas kyang de ltar bsam mo //
translated: Also imagine that white light rays come from that.

original: yang na dug gi 'og tu yi ge phu: nag po las byung ba'i rlung gi tshogs drag pos gtor bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na dug gi 'og tu yi ge phu: nag po las byung ba'i rlung gi tshogs drag pos gtor bar bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, a black syllable phaṭ arises from below the poison, and a violent mass of wind blows it away.

original: yang na lag pa sprul mgo'i zhags pa'i phyag rgya bcings te /
analyzed: yang na lag pa sprul mgo'i zhags pa'i phyag rgya bcings te /
translated: Alternatively, form the mudra of the snake-headed noose with the right hand,

original: phu: zhes brjod pa dang phyag rgya'i stobs kyis dug drangs te /
analyzed: phu: zhes brjod pa dang phyag rgya'i stobs kyis dug drangs te /
translated: and say phaṭ. By the power of the mudra, the poison is drawn out,

original: sa dang chu dang me dang ka pa la sogs par spo ste /
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang ka pa la sogs par spo ste /
translated: and is transferred to the earth, water, fire, skull, and so on.

original: rnal 'byor 'di gsum gang yang rung bas dug bsal bar gyur pa ni /
analyzed: rnal 'byor 'di gsum gang yang rung bas dug bsal bar gyur pa ni /
translated: Any of these three yogas can be used to remove the poison.

original: dug de srang la bcal ba nyung bar gyur pa na'o //
analyzed: dug de srang la bcal ba nyung bar gyur pa na'o //
translated: When the poison is weighed on a scale, it will be less.

original: de nas de mda' dug gam sprul gyi dug rnams rnal 'byor gang la goms pa de nyid kyis bsal te /
analyzed: de nas de mda' dug gam sprul gyi dug rnams rnal 'byor gang la goms pa de nyid kyis bsal te /

analyzed: 'di ni nang gi rnal 'byor kho nas dug bsal ba yin la /

original: phyi rol gyi bya bas dug bsal ba ma gsungs so //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi bya bas dug bsal ba ma gsungs so //

original: de la 'dir phyag rgya ni /
analyzed: de la 'dir phyag rgya ni /

analyzed: lag pa g-yas pa'i mthe bong dang mdzub mo rtse sprad pas zhags mig ltar byas te /

analyzed: sor mo gzhan brkyang la /

original: cung zad dgu por byas la /

analyzed: sprul mgo'i gdengs ka ltar bya'o //

original: pags pa sha dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: pags pa sha dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /

original: rab tu zhe na pa'i dug la sogs pa rnams sel bar ston to //
analyzed: rab tu zhe na pa'i dug la sogs pa rnams sel bar ston to //
translated: it shows the removal of intense poisons and so on.

original: phud ces bya ba'i lag pas drang zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor gsum gyi nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: phud ces bya ba'i lag pas drang zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor gsum gyi nye bar mtshon pa'o //

original: khu tshur gyis kyang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khu tshur gyis kyang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also with a fist

analyzed: phyag rgya dang bral ba'i lag pas kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: dkyil 'khor drug @327b pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor drug @327b pa'i 'grel pa'o /

original: // / de ni de nas lha chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: // / de ni de nas lha chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pas /

analyzed: lha chen po rnams kyi dkyil 'khor ston te /

original: 'di ni lha chen po rnams kyi bdag po yang yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni lha chen po rnams kyi bdag po yang yin la /

original: 'jigs par byed pa chen po yang yin la /
analyzed: 'jigs par byed pa chen po yang yin la /

original: de ni lha'i lha chen po zhes zer te /
analyzed: de ni lha'i lha chen po zhes zer te /

analyzed: rang gi gzugs dang lag ca dang / ro phyed tshig pa za bas dur khrod du lhag ma rnams 'jigs par byed pa'am /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje khams gsum gyi bdag po rnams btul ba na /
translated: When the Blessed One Vajrapāṇi subdued the lords of the three realms,

analyzed: 'di 'jigs pa'i gzugs ba stan te /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la kva'i gnod spyin khyod kyang nga'i bka' nyon cig smras pa'i phyir ro //

original: yang na 'di snying rje nyid kyis 'jigs su rung bar sprul te /
analyzed: yang na 'di snying rje nyid kyis 'jigs su rung bar sprul te /
translated: Or else, he emanated a terrifying form out of compassion,

original: 'gro ba rnams gdul ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams gdul ba'o //

original: bud med chen po brgyang kyis bskor //
analyzed: bud med chen po brgyang kyis bskor //

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is

analyzed: 'di ni rtag tu dus mtshan dang / tshangs ma dang / khyab 'jug dang / gzhon nu ma dang / phag mo dang / gshin rje ma dang / dbang mo dang / lus ngan ma la sogs pa'i ma mo rang gi chung ma drag mo dang bcas pa'i ma mo rnams kyis bskor ba'o //

original: bcom ldan 'das la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The Blessed One, etc. is easy to understand.

original: 'jigs par byed pa'i sgra phyung nas //
analyzed: 'jigs par byed pa'i sgra phyung nas //
translated: Having uttered a terrifying sound,

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: this is

original: ha ha zhes drag tu smras nas so //
analyzed: ha ha zhes drag tu smras nas so //
translated: having uttered a fierce “ha ha.”

analyzed: 'di dag gi gsang sngags rnams ni sngar lha rnams ba stan pa dang spyar ro ;
translated: Their mantras are to be combined with the previously taught deities.

original: / bum pa'am mgo bo'i thod pa ni //
analyzed: / bum pa'am mgo bo'i thod pa ni //
translated: The water jar or the skull on the head

analyzed: de ltar brgyang kyis dbang bskur ro //
translated: is thus the consecration.

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang rang gi sngags kyi mthar aa bhi shinytsa mam zhes brjod de dbang bskur la /
translated: This is the consecration with the mantra “abhiṣiñcantu mam” at the end of each one’s mantra.

original: yang phyag rgya'i dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: yang phyag rgya'i dbang bskur ro //
translated: Again, there is the consecration of the consort.

original: de nas las rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dngos grub ston te /
analyzed: de nas las rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dngos grub ston te /
translated: Then, “one should perform the rites” and so forth teaches the powers.

original: dkyil 'khor du bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: One should perform the rites in the mandala.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //🔽sa rnams spyin pa ma gtogs par //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o // sa rnams spyin pa ma gtogs par //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Except for the giving of the earth” and so forth🔽teaches

original: 'di dag rab tu mthu dang ldan par ston pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag rab tu mthu dang ldan par ston pa ste /
translated: the powers.

original: sa spyin pa ni rang gi sems rab tu spyang ba 'ba' zhig la rag las pas de ni mi nus te gzhan spyin ba ste /🔽ji skad du /
analyzed: sa spyin pa ni rang gi sems rab tu spyang ba 'ba' zhig la rag las pas de ni mi nus te gzhan spyin ba ste / ji skad du /
translated: Giving the earth depends solely on the purification of one’s own mind, so that is not possible.

original: 'phags pa da kho na nyid 'dus pa las /🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i bdag po de dag la /
analyzed: 'phags pa da kho na nyid 'dus pa las / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i bdag po de dag la /
translated: As it says in the noble Compendium of Principles:

original: 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Lord of Gods said this to the Blessed One:🔽“Friends, you should practice giving to me unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.”

original: grogs rnams kho bo la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub spyin par sgrubs shig / de nas de dag gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: grogs rnams kho bo la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub spyin par sgrubs shig / de nas de dag gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then they said this:

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag cag gis byang chub rtsol bar mi @328a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag cag gis byang chub rtsol bar mi @328a * //
translated: “Blessed One, we are not able to strive for enlightenment.

original: nus so // ci ste bdag cag gis nus par gyur na /
analyzed: nus so // ci ste bdag cag gis nus par gyur na /
translated: If we were able,

original: bdag cag nyid yang dag par 'tshang rgya bar bgyid do zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag cag nyid yang dag par 'tshang rgya bar bgyid do zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //

original: bde chen zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa po la'ang drag po ste des so //
analyzed: bde chen zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa po la'ang drag po ste des so //
translated: “Great bliss” is the adept, and “by that” is Rudra.

original: h'um gi tshul gyis rtsol zhes bya bas nga rgyal byas la /
analyzed: h'um gi tshul gyis rtsol zhes bya bas nga rgyal byas la /
translated: “By the method of HŪṀ, one should make effort” means one should have pride.

original: blang ba'am / h'um zhes brjod cing dngos grub ster ba'o //
analyzed: blang ba'am / h'um zhes brjod cing dngos grub ster ba'o //
translated: “One should take” or “one should say HŪṀ” is the bestowal of spiritual powers.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: skrag na de ma thag tu gsod //
analyzed: skrag na de ma thag tu gsod //
translated: If frightened, one should immediately kill.

original: ces bya ba ni 'jigs par mi bya ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni 'jigs par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not be afraid.

original: 'phags pa de kho na nyid 'dus pa las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa de kho na nyid 'dus pa las kyang /
translated: It is also said in the Noble Compendium of Principles:

original: 'jigs pas lhag pa'i bgegs gzhan med //🔽ces gsungs la /
analyzed: 'jigs pas lhag pa'i bgegs gzhan med // ces gsungs la /
translated: There is no obstacle higher than fear.

original: rdo rje 'jigs par byed pa las kyang /
analyzed: rdo rje 'jigs par byed pa las kyang /
translated: And in the Vajra Terror:

original: de la 'jigs pa chen po 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'jigs pa chen po 'byung bar 'gyur te /

original: sngags pas de la 'jigs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: sngags pas de la 'jigs par mi bya'o //

analyzed: ji ltar 'jigs pa de ltar bgegs kyi bar chad du 'gyur ro //

original: bar chad du gyur na dngos grub med de /
analyzed: bar chad du gyur na dngos grub med de /

original: de'i phyir sngags pas 'jigs par mi bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sngags pas 'jigs par mi bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the mantrin should not be afraid.

original: gal te 'jigs pa na /
analyzed: gal te 'jigs pa na /
translated: If there is fear,

original: h'um h'um zhes 'brug ltar sgrogs shing /
analyzed: h'um h'um zhes 'brug ltar sgrogs shing /
translated: roaring like thunder with “hum hum,”

original: rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor dran pas zhi bar 'gyur ro zhes kyang dpal rdo rje 'chang gis gsung ste /
analyzed: rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor dran pas zhi bar 'gyur ro zhes kyang dpal rdo rje 'chang gis gsung ste /
translated: and recollecting one’s deity yoga, it will be pacified.

original: de bas na h'um gi tshul gyis gsol zhes sngar gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na h'um gi tshul gyis gsol zhes sngar gsungs so //
translated: Thus, Śrī Vajradhara also said, “Therefore, request with the method of hum.”

original: ci'i phyir rab tu zhi ba'i lha rnams sgrub pa po la skrag par byed /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rab tu zhi ba'i lha rnams sgrub pa po la skrag par byed /
translated: Why do the peaceful deities frighten the practitioner?

analyzed: thog ma nas rab tu zhi ba'i lus kyis dngos grub mi spyin zhe na /

analyzed: lha rnams ni rab tu zhi bar gnas te / sgrub pa po'i bsam pa'i dbang gis las kyi bag chags dang mthun par drag po la sogs par mthong ste /
translated: the deities abide in peace,

original: sngon chad ser sna ba stan pa'i phyir //🔽bgegs ni rang gi sems las byung //
analyzed: sngon chad ser sna ba stan pa'i phyir // bgegs ni rang gi sems las byung //
translated: but due to the power of the practitioner’s intention, they are seen as wrathful like Rudra and so forth in accordance with karmic propensities.🔽In order to teach that,🔽the verse “The obstructors arise from one’s own mind”

original: zhes tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pas so //
analyzed: zhes tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pas so //
translated: was spoken.

original: dkyil 'khor bdun pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bdun pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the seventh chapter of the tantra.

original: // / da ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'jigs byed de dag nyid zhi bar snang ba'i dkyil 'khor ston te /
analyzed: // / da ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'jigs byed de dag nyid zhi bar snang ba'i dkyil 'khor ston te /
translated: Now, then, from “Then” and so on, he teaches the mandala of the appearance of their pacification.

original: rang gi dkyil 'khor chung ma rnams //
analyzed: rang gi dkyil 'khor chung ma rnams //
translated: “Their own mandalas and wives”

original: zhes bya ba ni sngar ba stan pa nyid zhi bar snang bar mgul nas 'khyud pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngar ba stan pa nyid zhi bar snang bar mgul nas 'khyud pa ste /
translated: means that they are embraced by the appearance of their pacification, as previously explained.

original: 'dir de dag gi don ni sngar smras zin to //
analyzed: 'dir de dag gi don ni sngar smras zin to //
translated: Here, their meaning has already been stated.

original: mtho ris kyi lam zhes bya ba ni dge ba bcu'o //
analyzed: mtho ris kyi lam zhes bya ba ni dge ba bcu'o //
translated: “The path to heaven” is the ten virtues.

original: bder 'gro lam zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi'o //
analyzed: bder 'gro lam zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi'o //
translated: “The path to happiness” are the four concentrations.

original: ngan song ma lags pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: ngan song ma lags pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: “The path that is not a bad destination” is mundane right view.

original: sgrib pa ma mchis pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sgrib pa ma mchis pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The path that is not an obscuration”

original: tshogs kyi lam phal @328b pa'o ;
analyzed: tshogs kyi lam phal @328b pa'o ;
translated: is the path of accumulation in general.

original: / dben pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: / dben pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
translated: “The path of solitude” are the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation.

original: rnam par dben pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par dben pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The path of isolation”

original: sbyor ba'i lam dang po drod ces bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam dang po drod ces bya'o //
translated: is the first stage of the path of preparation, called “heat.”

original: 'byung pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni rtse mo'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: 'byung pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni rtse mo'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The path of the elements is the nature of the peak.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni bzod par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni bzod par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The path of nirvana is the stage of acquiescence.

original: dam pa'i chos kyi lam zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i chos mchog go //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi lam zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i chos mchog go //
translated: The path of the holy Dharma is the supreme worldly dharmas.

original: bde 'gro'i lam zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi'o //🔽spang ba'i lam zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bde 'gro'i lam zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi'o // spang ba'i lam zhes pa ni /

original: bsgom pa'i lam nyid do //🔽nyon mongs pa med pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam nyid do // nyon mongs pa med pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The path of abandonment is the path of cultivation.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The path of the absence of afflictions is the uninterrupted path, the vajra-like concentration.

original: ba stan par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ba stan par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: I will explain the path of the accomplishment of Buddhahood.

original: dngos dang brgyud pas zhes so //
analyzed: dngos dang brgyud pas zhes so //
translated: This is by direct and indirect paths.

original: tshig de dag kyang rang rang gi lam dang ji ltar 'tsham par dgrol te /
analyzed: tshig de dag kyang rang rang gi lam dang ji ltar 'tsham par dgrol te /
translated: These words are to be explained in accordance with their respective paths.

original: bdag gis ni gzhung mangs pas 'jigs pas ma bkrol lo //
analyzed: bdag gis ni gzhung mangs pas 'jigs pas ma bkrol lo //
translated: But I will not explain them here, fearing prolixity.

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'grub pa'i lam ba stan par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'grub pa'i lam ba stan par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: I will explain the path of the accomplishment of Buddhahood.

original: mdor na lam dpag tu med pa de dag kyang sangs rgyas la spyar ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdor na lam dpag tu med pa de dag kyang sangs rgyas la spyar ro zhes bya'o //
translated: In brief, those immeasurable paths are to be applied to the Buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa' nyid ni 'dir bden pa mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyid ni 'dir bden pa mthong ba yin la /
translated: The Bodhisattva is one who sees the truth here.

original: de'i lam nyid de 'grub par byed de /
analyzed: de'i lam nyid de 'grub par byed de /
translated: His path is that which accomplishes it.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams so //
translated: The perfections are that.

original: ba stan par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ba stan par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: I will teach it as before.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid 'grub pa'i las ni dbang bskur ba dang bsnyen pa la sogs pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid 'grub pa'i las ni dbang bskur ba dang bsnyen pa la sogs pa'i lam ste /
translated: The action which accomplishes the state of Vajra Holder is the path of consecration, service, etc.

original: de snga ma ltar ba stan par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de snga ma ltar ba stan par bgyi'o //
translated: I will teach it as before.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' dang / rdo rje 'chang ba 'di gnyis kyang khyad par ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' dang / rdo rje 'chang ba 'di gnyis kyang khyad par ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the difference between these two, the Bodhisattva and the Vajra Holder?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dang gsang sngags kyi sgo nas sa brgyang pa'i bar du mi 'dra bar bzhugs pa gnyis la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dang gsang sngags kyi sgo nas sa brgyang pa'i bar du mi 'dra bar bzhugs pa gnyis la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The two who abide in the stages up to the eighth through the perfections and the mantra door are called that.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rgyal ba'i zhing rnams sa 'thob kyang //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i zhing rnams sa 'thob kyang //
translated: Even though the Buddha-fields are attained,

original: yid bstod par ni 'gyur min te //
analyzed: yid bstod par ni 'gyur min te //
translated: the mind is not satisfied.

original: ji srid sa brgyang la gnas par //
analyzed: ji srid sa brgyang la gnas par //
translated: As long as one abides on the ninth stage,

original: theg dman 'jigs pa de la yod //
analyzed: theg dman 'jigs pa de la yod //
translated: there is fear of the Hīnayāna.

original: gsang pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po 'dir //
analyzed: gsang pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po 'dir //

translated: The mantra is capable of accomplishing all those aims merely by being uttered.

original: gcig tu bsgom pa kho nar pa nges te dbye ba ni de yin no //
analyzed: gcig tu bsgom pa kho nar pa nges te dbye ba ni de yin no //
translated: It is not certain that it is only to be meditated upon in one place. That is the difference.

original: de @330b bzhin du gsang sngags rnams la yang rig pa dang gzungs dang / gsang sngags zhes gsum du gsungs te /
analyzed: de @330b bzhin du gsang sngags rnams la yang rig pa dang gzungs dang / gsang sngags zhes gsum du gsungs te /
translated: Similarly, with regard to the mantras, three are mentioned: knowledge, dhāraṇī, and mantra.

original: lha de 'bod pa dang rig pa bskyed pa la sogs pa dang / ngan 'go la 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir de dag la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: lha de 'bod pa dang rig pa bskyed pa la sogs pa dang / ngan 'go la 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir de dag la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: Because they call out to the gods, generate awareness, and so forth, and because they hold the evil at bay, they are called vidya-mantras.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it has been said:🔽The Buddhas, Bodhisattvas,

original: sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' dang // mkha' 'gro btsun mo bzang mo rnams //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' dang // mkha' 'gro btsun mo bzang mo rnams //
translated: Dakinis, and Bhadra Yoginis

original: 'bong cing sngon du byed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'bong cing sngon du byed pa'i phyir //
translated: Call out and come first,

original: gsang sngags zhes ni mngon par brjod //
analyzed: gsang sngags zhes ni mngon par brjod //
translated: So they are called vidya-mantras.

original: dper na mi chen 'ga' zhig gis //
analyzed: dper na mi chen 'ga' zhig gis //
translated: For example, if a great man

original: skad ni drag pos pos gyur na //
analyzed: skad ni drag pos pos gyur na //
translated: Is called by a loud voice,

original: thos pa tsam gyis 'ong ba ltar //
analyzed: thos pa tsam gyis 'ong ba ltar //
translated: Just by hearing it he comes.

original: de bzhin sangs rgyas mdo la byon // zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin sangs rgyas mdo la byon // zhes gsungs so //
translated: In the same way, the Buddhas come to the Sutras.🔽In order to destroy ignorance

original: ma rig pa ni gzhig pa dang // ngag gi rigs mchog bsgrubs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni gzhig pa dang // ngag gi rigs mchog bsgrubs pa'i phyir //
translated: And accomplish the supreme family of speech,

original: dngos grub dam pa yod pa ste //
analyzed: dngos grub dam pa yod pa ste //
translated: The supreme siddhi exists.

original: de bas rig sngags zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas rig sngags zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called vidya-mantra.

original: zhes pa dang yang /
analyzed: zhes pa dang yang /
translated: And it is also said:

original: gzung sa ni rnam gsum dag gi phyir //
analyzed: gzung sa ni rnam gsum dag gi phyir //
translated: Because there are three kinds of retention,

original: tshig dang don dang gnyi ga'i gzungs //
analyzed: tshig dang don dang gnyi ga'i gzungs //
translated: There are retention of words, meaning, and both.

original: legs pa las ni nyams pa na //
analyzed: legs pa las ni nyams pa na //
translated: If one degenerates from the good,

original: 'dzin par byed pa de phyir gsungs //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa de phyir gsungs //
translated: Therefore, it is called mantra.

original: zhes so // 'di dag kyang gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes so // 'di dag kyang gsungs te /
translated: And it is said:

original: brjod par bya ba yin pa'am //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba yin pa'am //
translated: It is to be expressed,🔽Or it is the union of means and wisdom,

original: thabs dang shes rab 'brel pa dang // 'da' bar bya ba ma yin zhing //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab 'brel pa dang // 'da' bar bya ba ma yin zhing //
translated: It is not to be transgressed,

original: shigs par dka' bas gsang ba nyid //
analyzed: shigs par dka' bas gsang ba nyid //
translated: And it is secret because it is difficult to destroy.

original: gsang ba sgrub phyir bsngags pas na //
analyzed: gsang ba sgrub phyir bsngags pas na //
translated: Because it is praised for accomplishing the secret,

original: de bas gsang sngags nges par brjod //
analyzed: de bas gsang sngags nges par brjod //
translated: Therefore, mantra is definitely expressed.🔽Thus, it is mostly taught with the term mantra because it has the characteristics of being expressible,

original: ces bya ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pas phal cher gsang sngags kyi sgrar ba stan gyi rig pa dang gzungs su ma yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pas phal cher gsang sngags kyi sgrar ba stan gyi rig pa dang gzungs su ma yin no //
translated: or being the union of means and wisdom,🔽or being secret because it is difficult to destroy.

original: 'ga' zhig tu rtags tsam la brten te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu rtags tsam la brten te /
translated: In some cases, based on just the signs,

original: lha pho'i ngo bo dang 'brel pa la ni gsang sngags zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: lha pho'i ngo bo dang 'brel pa la ni gsang sngags zhes gsungs la /
translated: that which is connected with the essence of a male deity is called mantra,

original: lha mo dang 'brel pa la ni rig sngags dang gzungs sngags zhes gsungs so //🔽phal cher ni sngags gcig nyid dang lha gcig nyid dang 'brel pa las /
analyzed: lha mo dang 'brel pa la ni rig sngags dang gzungs sngags zhes gsungs so // phal cher ni sngags gcig nyid dang lha gcig nyid dang 'brel pa las /
translated: and that which is connected with a female deity is called vidyā and dhāraṇī.

original: ming bzhi char brjod do //
analyzed: ming bzhi char brjod do //
translated: However, for the most part, the four names are used in connection with a single mantra and a single deity.

original: 'di dag ni rang gi ngo bo yang shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin ni snying po'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rang gi ngo bo yang shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin ni snying po'o //
translated: Wisdom and samadhi are the essence.

original: shes rab dang snying rje'i bdag nyid ni gsang sngags so //🔽shes rab dang ye shes ni rig sngags so //
analyzed: shes rab dang snying rje'i bdag nyid ni gsang sngags so // shes rab dang ye shes ni rig sngags so //
translated: Wisdom and compassion are the secret mantra.🔽Wisdom and gnosis are the knowledge mantra.

original: shes rab dang dran pa ni gzungs sngags te /
analyzed: shes rab dang dran pa ni gzungs sngags te /
translated: Wisdom and mindfulness are the dharani mantra.

original: de ltar ni gzhung gzhan dag las kyang dran pa dang shes rab yang dag par ldan pa'i sems ni gzungs zhes bya ba'i sgrar bshad do zhes ba stan to //
analyzed: de ltar ni gzhung gzhan dag las kyang dran pa dang shes rab yang dag par ldan pa'i sems ni gzungs zhes bya ba'i sgrar bshad do zhes ba stan to //
translated: In other texts it is explained that the mind endowed with mindfulness and wisdom is called the sound of dharani.

original: rang rang gi ngo bo de dag kyang rang rang gi ming kho nas khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang rang gi ngo bo de dag kyang rang rang gi ming kho nas khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: Their individual natures can be understood from their individual names.

original: de bzhin du 'di dag ni bsgrubs par bya ba dang / sgrub pa po dang sgrub par byed pa gsum la yang 'jug cing @331a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di dag ni bsgrubs par bya ba dang / sgrub pa po dang sgrub par byed pa gsum la yang 'jug cing @331a * //
translated: In the same way, these three are also applied to the object of attainment, the practitioner, and the means of attainment.

original: sgrub par byed pa la sogs pa yang ci rigs su dbye ste zhar la 'ongs pas chog go //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa la sogs pa yang ci rigs su dbye ste zhar la 'ongs pas chog go //
translated: The means of attainment and so forth should be classified as appropriate. This digression is sufficient.

original: de nas de dag gi dkyil 'khor bshad de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: de nas de dag gi dkyil 'khor bshad de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: Then, the explanation of their maṇḍala is easy to understand.

original: bum ba lnga dang brgyang ces bya ba ni lha lnga dang mchod pa dang sgo skyong dang brgyang la thun mong du bzhi dang / gsang ba'i bum pa dang bcu las /
analyzed: bum ba lnga dang brgyang ces bya ba ni lha lnga dang mchod pa dang sgo skyong dang brgyang la thun mong du bzhi dang / gsang ba'i bum pa dang bcu las /
translated: “ Five vases and a full vase” means that the four are common to the five deities, the offerings, and the gate protectors, and the secret vase.

original: bdag po dang gsang ba'i bum pa ni smos mi dgos pas lhag ma brgyang do //
analyzed: bdag po dang gsang ba'i bum pa ni smos mi dgos pas lhag ma brgyang do //
translated: Since the master and the secret vase are not to be mentioned, the remaining four are full.

original: de ma rnyed na rigs lnga dang gsang ba'i bum par bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de ma rnyed na rigs lnga dang gsang ba'i bum par bcas pa'o //
translated: If one does not find them, there are the five families and the secret vase.

original: kha cig ni dbang bskur pa'i bum pa lnga dang bkang ba'i bum pa brgyang do zhes rtog go //
analyzed: kha cig ni dbang bskur pa'i bum pa lnga dang bkang ba'i bum pa brgyang do zhes rtog go //
translated: Some imagine that there are five vases for the conferral of empowerment and a full vase.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i sngags kyis zhes bya ba ni bdag po'i sngags gtso bor byas te'o //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i sngags kyis zhes bya ba ni bdag po'i sngags gtso bor byas te'o //
translated: “ The mantra of the cakravartin” means that the mantra of the master is primary.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: aom badzra dha ra zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bdag nyid rigs thams cad kyi sems par mos par byas te /
analyzed: aom badzra dha ra zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bdag nyid rigs thams cad kyi sems par mos par byas te /
translated: “ Oṃ vajra-dhara” and so forth means that one should imagine oneself as the mind of all the families.

original: slob ma gzhug pa ste /
analyzed: slob ma gzhug pa ste /
translated: The disciple should enter.

original: 'di ni lugs gzhan du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lugs gzhan du gnas pa'o //
translated: This is the other system.

original: de nas phreng ba de nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dbang bskur ba ston to //
analyzed: de nas phreng ba de nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dbang bskur ba ston to //
translated: Then, with that very garland, etc. shows the consecration.

original: dang po ni lhag ma'i lha'i dbang ngo //
analyzed: dang po ni lhag ma'i lha'i dbang ngo //
translated: The first is the consecration of the remaining deities.

original: gnyis pa ni bum pa'i dbang ngo //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni bum pa'i dbang ngo //
translated: The second is the vase consecration.

original: gsum pa ni dam tshig spyin pa'i dbang ngo //
analyzed: gsum pa ni dam tshig spyin pa'i dbang ngo //
translated: The third is the consecration of the bestowal of the vow.

original: bzhi pa ni 'chad par rjes su ngang ba'i dbang ngo //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni 'chad par rjes su ngang ba'i dbang ngo //
translated: The fourth is the consecration of the explanation of the vow.

original: lnga pa ni bsgrub par ngang ba'i dpang ste /
analyzed: lnga pa ni bsgrub par ngang ba'i dpang ste /
translated: The fifth is the consecration of the practice of the vow.

original: lugs 'di ni dkyil 'khor gzhan dang cung zad mi 'dra ba nyid yin pas gzhan gyis mi drang ngo //
analyzed: lugs 'di ni dkyil 'khor gzhan dang cung zad mi 'dra ba nyid yin pas gzhan gyis mi drang ngo //
translated: This system is slightly different from the other mandalas, so it is not to be drawn by others.

original: tshig gi don ni go sla'o //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of the words is easy to understand.

original: de nas bla ma la khyod kyis yon gyi mchog ni dbul bar bya zhing /
analyzed: de nas bla ma la khyod kyis yon gyi mchog ni dbul bar bya zhing /
translated: Then, to the guru you should offer the best gift.

original: de yang rnyed pas rnyed pa la sogs pa bsgrub par srid pas /
analyzed: de yang rnyed pas rnyed pa la sogs pa bsgrub par srid pas /
translated: And since that is accomplished by gain, gain, etc.,

original: bla ma kho na'i phyir /
analyzed: bla ma kho na'i phyir /
translated: for the sake of the guru alone,

original: nor dang dbyig la sogs pa dbul te go sla'o //
analyzed: nor dang dbyig la sogs pa dbul te go sla'o //
translated: you should offer wealth, jewels, etc.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i 'bras bu ston te go sla'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i 'bras bu ston te go sla'o //
translated: Then, etc. shows its result, which is easy to understand.

original: de nas bu la zhes bya ba la sogs pas man ngag ba stan par ston te /
analyzed: de nas bu la zhes bya ba la sogs pas man ngag ba stan par ston te /
translated: Then, etc. shows the teaching of the intimate instruction.

original: chos rnams thams cad dngos med par //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad dngos med par //
translated: All phenomena are non-entity,

original: sems kyis bsgom par byas nas ni //
analyzed: sems kyis bsgom par byas nas ni //
translated: having been cultivated by the mind.

original: zhes bya ba ni ye shes dbab pa'am /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ye shes dbab pa'am /
translated: This is the descent of pristine consciousness,

original: sems so sor rtogs pa'i skabs so //
analyzed: sems so sor rtogs pa'i skabs so //
translated: or the occasion of discerning the mind.

original: de nas ni aa zhes bya ba ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid las thabs kyis zla ba'i dkyil 'khor du bsams te /
analyzed: de nas ni aa zhes bya ba ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid las thabs kyis zla ba'i dkyil 'khor du bsams te /
translated: Then, from the syllable A, the nature of non-arising, one should imagine the moon mandala through the method.

original: kha cig na re yi ge aa dkar po nyid las zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re yi ge aa dkar po nyid las zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that it is from the white syllable A itself.

original: de nas rang gi lhag pa'i lha'i sa bon gyi yig 'bru zla ba de'i dbus su 'od zer dang bcas pas bsams nas /
analyzed: de nas rang gi lhag pa'i lha'i sa bon gyi yig 'bru zla ba de'i dbus su 'od zer dang bcas pas bsams nas /
translated: Then, in the center of that moon, one should imagine the seed syllable of one’s favored deity, together with light rays.

original: de las 'od zer 'phro ba dang 'du ba'i dbang las rdo rje la sogs pa rang gi lha'i dam tshig gi phyag @331b rgya dag tu gyur par bsam zhing /
analyzed: de las 'od zer 'phro ba dang 'du ba'i dbang las rdo rje la sogs pa rang gi lha'i dam tshig gi phyag @331b rgya dag tu gyur par bsam zhing /
translated: From that, one should imagine that light rays radiate and return, transforming into the pledge seal of one’s deity, such as a vajra, and so on.

original: de nas kyang 'od zer spro ba dang bsdu bas stong pa las zla ba la sogs par gyur pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rang gi lha'i de nyid du phyag rgya de dang de las sgrub pa po bdag nyid kha ni bsgyur bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas kyang 'od zer spro ba dang bsdu bas stong pa las zla ba la sogs par gyur pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rang gi lha'i de nyid du phyag rgya de dang de las sgrub pa po bdag nyid kha ni bsgyur bar bya ste /
translated: Then, by the emission and re-absorption of light rays, from emptiness one becomes a moon disc, and so forth. In the same way, here also, from that and that seal, the practitioner should transform himself into the reality of his deity.

original: ni zhes bya ba ni nges par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni nges par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word “only” means “certainly.”

original: gzhan dun don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dun don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is meaningless otherwise.

original: de ltar sngags pa lha'i rnal 'byor gyi tshul du bsgyur nas /
analyzed: de ltar sngags pa lha'i rnal 'byor gyi tshul du bsgyur nas /
translated: Thus, having transformed into the manner of deity yoga,

original: da ni ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: da ni ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: now what should one do?

original: de nas de ma thag tu rang gi sa bon dang 'dra ba'i rdo rje sems dpa' rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i phyag rgyas phyag rgya ste rang gi lus phyag rgya chen po de brtan par byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: de nas de ma thag tu rang gi sa bon dang 'dra ba'i rdo rje sems dpa' rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i phyag rgyas phyag rgya ste rang gi lus phyag rgya chen po de brtan par byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: Then, immediately, with the seal of Vajrasattva, who is similar to one’s seed, and so forth, one should stabilize one’s body, the great seal, by consecrating it.

original: ji skad du /🔽rdo rje sems dpa'i ting 'dzin gyis //
analyzed: ji skad du / rdo rje sems dpa'i ting 'dzin gyis //
translated: As it is said:🔽By the meditative concentration of Vajrasattva,

original: sems dpa' rdo rje dam byas la //
analyzed: sems dpa' rdo rje dam byas la //
translated: one should make the seal of Vajrasattva.

original: snying ga mdzod spu mgrin pa dang // spyi bor bzhag na byin gyis rlob //
analyzed: snying ga mdzod spu mgrin pa dang // spyi bor bzhag na byin gyis rlob //
translated: When placed on the heart, the tuft, the throat, and the head, there is consecration.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: ci'i de tsam du zad dam snyam pa las /
analyzed: ci'i de tsam du zad dam snyam pa las /
translated: If one thinks that is all,

original: lhag ces bya ba dam tshig sems dpa' chen por mos pa la sogs pa yang sngon du bya zhing /
analyzed: lhag ces bya ba dam tshig sems dpa' chen por mos pa la sogs pa yang sngon du bya zhing /
translated: it is said that one should also perform the preliminary of imagining the great pledge being, and so forth.

original: 'gro zhes bya ba sku gsung thugs gcig pu mos pa la sogs pa'i bya ba yang bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro zhes bya ba sku gsung thugs gcig pu mos pa la sogs pa'i bya ba yang bya'o //
translated: It is said that one should also perform the action of imagining the body, speech, and mind as one, and so forth.

original: de dag kyang rtsa ba'i rgyud las ji ltar gsungs pa'i rim pa ji bzhin du ma nor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang rtsa ba'i rgyud las ji ltar gsungs pa'i rim pa ji bzhin du ma nor bar bya'o //
translated: Those should be done without error, just as they are taught in the Root Tantra.

original: cho ga de dag las gtsor gyur pa ni /
analyzed: cho ga de dag las gtsor gyur pa ni /
translated: Among those rites, the most important is

original: dbang bskur ba yin pas dngos su smos te /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba yin pas dngos su smos te /
translated: the empowerment, which is mentioned explicitly.

original: sangs rgyas lnga rnams kyis dbu rgyan du dbang bskur ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga rnams kyis dbu rgyan du dbang bskur ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The five buddhas confer the empowerment of the crown.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rdo rje dbyings dbang la sogs pa //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings dbang la sogs pa //
translated: The empowerment of the vajra realm, and so forth,

original: sangs rgyas phyag rgya mdun nas ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas phyag rgya mdun nas ni //
translated: is conferred by the buddhas in front.

original: brtsam par byas nas ngos bzhir yang //
analyzed: brtsam par byas nas ngos bzhir yang //
translated: Having begun, on the four sides

original: phreng ba nyid kyis dbang bskur 'gyur //
analyzed: phreng ba nyid kyis dbang bskur 'gyur //
translated: the empowerment is conferred by the garland.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is stated.

original: de ltar smos pa dang ma smos pa dang cho ga ma lus pa'i sgo nas bdag nyid mthu thob par bsams te /
analyzed: de ltar smos pa dang ma smos pa dang cho ga ma lus pa'i sgo nas bdag nyid mthu thob par bsams te /
translated: Thus, having imagined that one has attained power through the mentioned and unmentioned and all the rites,

original: bsnyen pa la sogs pa byas nas 'grub po zhes ba stan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsnyen pa la sogs pa byas nas 'grub po zhes ba stan pa'i phyir /
translated: one should accomplish the recitation and so forth.

original: de nas nga rgyal bskyed nas kyang //
analyzed: de nas nga rgyal bskyed nas kyang //
translated: Then, having generated pride,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te go sla'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te go sla'o //
translated: and so forth, are easy to understand.

original: de nas tshangs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba yang go sla ba nyid do //
analyzed: de nas tshangs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba yang go sla ba nyid do //
translated: Then, Brahma and so forth, is also easy to understand.

original: de'i sha dang rus pa dang skra dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i sha dang rus pa dang skra dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: His flesh, bones, and hair,

original: dkyil 'khor 'dir ro nyid legs par gtubs shing sdig pa spyang ba'i sngags kyis bsregs la /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor 'dir ro nyid legs par gtubs shing sdig pa spyang ba'i sngags kyis bsregs la /
translated: means that in this mandala, one should cut up the corpse well, burn it with the mantra for purifying evil,🔽and in the end, burn the bone ashes of the dead body.

original: tha ma shi ba de'i rus pa'i thal ba yang bsregs pas na thal ba la sogs pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: tha ma shi ba de'i rus pa'i thal ba yang bsregs pas na thal ba la sogs pa zhes smos te /
translated: Thus, it is called “ashes and so forth.”

original: dman pas mchog bsdu'i dkyil 'khor dgu pa'i 'grel pa ste rgyud phyi ma'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: dman pas mchog bsdu'i dkyil 'khor dgu pa'i 'grel pa ste rgyud phyi ma'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the ninth mandala of the Condensed Supreme Original Buddha,

original: // / da ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: // / da ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: Now, then, from “then” and so forth,

original: rtsa ba dang phyi ma'i rgyang du ma gsungs pa'i @332a * //
analyzed: rtsa ba dang phyi ma'i rgyang du ma gsungs pa'i @332a * //
translated: He did not teach the root and the later as separate.🔽

original: cho ga ma lus pa bsdus pa'i ngo bo rgyud phyi ma phyi ma ston te /
analyzed: cho ga ma lus pa bsdus pa'i ngo bo rgyud phyi ma phyi ma ston te /
translated: The later Continuation of the Continuation of the Compendium of Principles Tantra teaches the essence of the collection of all the rites not taught in the root and later continuations.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni sngon bzhin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni sngon bzhin no //
translated: The Bhagavān is as before.

original: phyag na rdo rjes zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyag na rdo rjes zhes bya ba ni /

original: bzhi pa ni phyag na padma'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni phyag na padma'o //

original: de nyid gnyis su byas na las kyi'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid gnyis su byas na las kyi'o zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: g-yas pa mdung rtse zhes bya ba ni smin drug gi bu'i'o //

original: rtse gsum zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtse gsum zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The “trident” is that of

original: stobs bzangs kyi'o //
analyzed: stobs bzangs kyi'o //

analyzed: aa dang aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dbang po'i'o //

analyzed: 'di dag ni lha chen po dang 'jigs byed rnams thun mong du bya ba'i phyag rgya'o //

analyzed: g-yon pa 'khor lor bya ba ni zla ba'i'o //

analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni phur bu'i'o //

original: ban glang sna ni sgra gcan no //
analyzed: ban glang sna ni sgra gcan no //

analyzed: rgyu skar rnams kyi ni lag pa g-yas pa steng du phyung ba las /

analyzed: gnyi pa kan te bsnol la sor mo bcu bsdu zhing spros pas me stag 'phro ba 'dra ba'o //

analyzed: phyag rgya de nyid myur du yan man du bskor na lto 'phye chen po rnams kyi phyag rgya ste /

original: glog gi phreng ba'o //
analyzed: glog gi phreng ba'o //

analyzed: de nyid phral te g-yas pa slar gzhag cing g-yon pa 'og tu gzhag pa ni dga' bo dang nye dga' bo'i sprin gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: If one separates that [mudrā] and places the right one above and the left one below, it is the cloud mudrā of Nanda and Upananda.

analyzed: 'di dag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma ltar gcig nyid la mtshan nyid gnyis su brtag pa'o ;

analyzed: / de bas na rgyud 'dir ni dam tshig dang las kyi phyag rgya dag tha mi dad do zhes bdag gis sngar smras zin to //

analyzed: srin lag rtsa ba zhes bya ba ni phyag na rdo rje tshe dpag tu med pa'i phyag rgya'o //

analyzed: nam mkha'i snying po zhes bya ba ni rdo rje rin chen no //

original: padma las byung ba zhes bya ba ni rdo rje chos so //
analyzed: padma las byung ba zhes bya ba ni rdo rje chos so //

analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni bdag por gnas pa dang sems dpa' dang po'i gnyig gzung ngo //
translated: The Vajrasattva is the lord, and the first hero is taken as both.

original: bde ba chen po dang kun du  bzang po ni go sla'o //
analyzed: bde ba chen po dang kun du  bzang po ni go sla'o //
translated: Great bliss and Samantabhadra are easy to understand.

original: khro bo sna tshogs kyi phyag rgya gzi can no zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya gcig po de nyid kyis khro bo me nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi khro bo sna tshogs pa'i phyag rgyar bya ba'o //

translated: The seal of the wrathful various is the powerful one. With just that one seal, one should make the seal of the wrathful various, the wrathful one in the mandala of the sun-disk.

analyzed: bsdams pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sems dpa' lhag ma rnams ni phyag rgya ba stan te go sla'o //
translated: The remaining heroes are taught by bound and so forth, which is easy to understand.

original: cung zad padma'i 'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: cung zad padma'i 'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: A little lotus means

original: tshe dpag tu med pa'i dkyil 'khor du sangs rgyas tshe mtha' yas kyi phyag rgya ni sngar padma las byung zhes bya bas ba stan zhing rigs lhag ma gsum gyi ni sngar rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi 'dral 'di ni sems dpa' rdo rje chos kyi phyag @336a * //
analyzed: tshe dpag tu med pa'i dkyil 'khor du sangs rgyas tshe mtha' yas kyi phyag rgya ni sngar padma las byung zhes bya bas ba stan zhing rigs lhag ma gsum gyi ni sngar rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi 'dral 'di ni sems dpa' rdo rje chos kyi phyag @336a * //
translated: that in the mandala of Amitāyus, the mudra of Buddha Amitāyus is taught by arising from a lotus before, and the remaining three families are taught by this verse from the Root Tantra: The mudra of Vajra Dharma is the same as the Dharma mudra.

original: rgya'o ; / mdor na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di yang dam tshig gi phyag rgya nyid las kyi phyag rgyar ba stan pa'o //🔽bsdus btud sprul mgor 'gyur zhes bya ba ni lag pa g-yon pa'i thal mo'i rgyab tu g-yas pa'i thal mo lto spyar la /
analyzed: rgya'o ; / mdor na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di yang dam tshig gi phyag rgya nyid las kyi phyag rgyar ba stan pa'o // bsdus btud sprul mgor 'gyur zhes bya ba ni lag pa g-yon pa'i thal mo'i rgyab tu g-yas pa'i thal mo lto spyar la /
translated: In brief, and so forth teaches that this is also a karma mudra from the samaya mudra.🔽The contracted bow is formed by placing the back of the left hand palm up and the right hand palm down,

original: sor mo rnams reg par bskyed cing rtse mo cung zad dgug par bya ba ste /
analyzed: sor mo rnams reg par bskyed cing rtse mo cung zad dgug par bya ba ste /
translated: and the fingers are brought together and slightly bent.

original: klu rnams sam gsang ba'i'o //
analyzed: klu rnams sam gsang ba'i'o //
translated: The serpent mudra is the secret one.

original: mche ba 'dra zhes bya ba ni sor mo bsnol ba'i snyim pa las mdzub mo gnyis mche ba ltar brkyang ba'o //🔽khrag 'phrog pa zhes bya ba ni /🔽sor mo'i rtse mo bsnol ba'i snyim pas mthe bong gnyis bzung ste mthe bong gnyis gshibs pa'o //
analyzed: mche ba 'dra zhes bya ba ni sor mo bsnol ba'i snyim pa las mdzub mo gnyis mche ba ltar brkyang ba'o // khrag 'phrog pa zhes bya ba ni / sor mo'i rtse mo bsnol ba'i snyim pas mthe bong gnyis bzung ste mthe bong gnyis gshibs pa'o //
translated: The fangs mudra is formed by interlacing the fingers in the hollow of the hands and extending the two index fingers like fangs.🔽 The blood-drinking mudra is formed by interlacing the tips of the fingers in the hollow of the hands and holding the two thumbs and pressing them together.

original: lag pas bskor ba zhes bya ba ni lag pa gnyis kyi thal mo tha dad par thad kar brkyang la bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: lag pas bskor ba zhes bya ba ni lag pa gnyis kyi thal mo tha dad par thad kar brkyang la bskyod pa ste /
translated: The hand-circling mudra is formed by extending the two palms separately in a straight line and moving them.

original: rlung gi zhes bya ba ni rlung lha ma lus pa'i'o //
analyzed: rlung gi zhes bya ba ni rlung lha ma lus pa'i'o //
translated: The wind mudra is for all the wind gods.

original: dbyug tor ldan pa zhes bya ba ni lag pa g-yas pa khu tshur ba cangs te phyar ba'am de'i yang mthe bong bsgreng ba ni gnod spyin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi bdag po lus ngan gyi'o //
analyzed: dbyug tor ldan pa zhes bya ba ni lag pa g-yas pa khu tshur ba cangs te phyar ba'am de'i yang mthe bong bsgreng ba ni gnod spyin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi bdag po lus ngan gyi'o //
translated: The club-bearing mudra is formed by clenching the right hand into a fist and raising it. The thumb-raised mudra is for the yakshas. The face-showing mudra is for the direction lords.🔽 The bow-and-arrow mudra is for the god of love. The sword-wielding mudra is for the gods. The spear-holding mudra is for the asuras.
